intro: Alternanthera multiflora, commonly known as redstem or redroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking red stems and leaves, which are often used in ornamental gardening. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Alternanthera multiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
